p.p: The illustration below is for left-hand drive vehicles. Some button positions are reversed for right-hand drive vehicles.
Refer to the “Navigation and Multimedia System Owner’s Manual”.

Interference may be heard through the audio system’s speakers if a cellular phone is being used 

inside or close to the vehicle while the audio system is operating.
Do not leave the audio system on longer than necessary with the engine is stopped.

title.title:
To avoid damaging the audio 

system

p.p:
Take care not to spill drinks or other fluids over the audio 

system.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Some audio features can be controlled using the switches on the steering wheel.
Operation may differ depending on the type of audio system or navigation system. For details, refer to the manual provided with the audio system or navigation system.

title.title: Operating the audio system using the steering wheel switches

itemtxt.itemtxt: Press and hold until you hear a beep: Continuously increases/decreases volume
Press: Turn the power on, select an audio source
Press and hold until you hear a beep:
To cancel the mute or pause, press and hold the switch again.
Press: Select a radio station saved in preset channels.
Press and hold until you hear a beep: Seek up/down
Press and hold until you hear a beep: Continuously increases/decreases volume
Press: Turn the power on, select an audio source
Press and hold until you hear a beep:
To cancel the mute or pause, press and hold the switch again.

p.p: Press the “MODE” switch when the audio system is turned on. The audio source changes as follows each time the button is pressed. If a mode cannot be used, it will be skipped.

title.title: To reduce the risk of an accident

p.p: Exercise care when operating the audio switches on the steering wheel.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Connect an iPod, USB memory device or portable audio player to the AUX port/USB port as indicated below. Press the “MODE” button to select “iPod”, “USB” or “AUX”.

title.title: Connecting using the AUX port/USB port

p.p: Connect an iPod using an iPod cable.

p_sub.p_sub: Turn on the power of the iPod if it is not turned on.
Turn on the power of the USB memory device if it is not turned on.
Turn on the power of the portable audio player if it is not turned on.

p.p: The AUX port only supports audio input.
Do not connect a device or operate the device controls.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The sound quality, volume balance and ASL settings can be adjusted and the day mode can be selected.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Press: Displays the “SETUP” menu/Selects the mode

p.p: When the headlights are turned on, the screen dims.
However, the screen can be switched to day mode by selecting day mode.
The screen will stay in day mode when the headlights are turned on until day mode is selected again.

steptxt.steptxt: Press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Turn the knob to select “Sound setting”.
Press the knob.
Turn the knob as corresponds to the desired mode.
Press the knob.

p.p: Turning the “TUNE•SELECT” knob adjusts the level.
The sound quality level is adjusted individually in each audio mode.
When ASL is selected, turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to change the amount of ASL.

p_sub.p_sub: ASL automatically adjusts the volume and tone quality according to vehicle speed.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Press the “MODE” button until “AM” or “FM” is displayed.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off

steptxt.steptxt: Search for the desired stations by turning the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or pressing the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Maintaining perfect radio reception at all times is difficult due to the continually changing position of the antenna, differences in signal strength and surrounding objects, such as trains, transmitters, etc.
The radio antenna is mounted on the roof.

title.title: Playing an audio CD and MP3/WMA discs

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Insert a disc, press the “MODE” button to begin listening to a CD.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off

title.title: Loading a CD or MP3/WMA/AAC disc
Ejecting a CD or MP3/WMA/AAC disc

p.p: Press the disc eject button and remove the disc.
Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down until the desired track number is displayed.

title.title: Selecting a track from a track list

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: The track list will be displayed.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn and press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to select a track.

p.p: Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.

title.title: Selecting folders one at a time
Selecting a folder and file from folder list

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: The folder list will be displayed.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn and press the knob to select a folder and a file.

p.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down to select the desired file.
Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.
Available except when “RDM” (random play) is selected
Depending on the contents recorded, the characters may not be displayed properly or may not be displayed at all.
If an error message is displayed, refer to the following table and take the appropriate measures. If the problem is not rectified, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer.
The disc may be dirty, damaged or inserted upside-down. Clean the disc or insert it correctly.
There is a trouble inside the system.
An over current error has occurred.
Operation has stopped due to a high temperature inside the player. Wait for a while and then press the “MODE” button. If the CD still cannot be played back, contact your Toyota dealer.
This indicates that the MP3, WMA or AAC file is not included in the CD.
Discs with the marks shown below can be used.
Playback may not be possible depending on recording format or disc features, or due to scratches, dirt or deterioration.
CDs with copy-protect features may not play correctly.
To protect the internal components, playback is automatically stopped when a problem is detected while the CD player is being used.

title.title: If a CD is left inside the CD player or in the ejected position for extended periods

p.p: The CD may be damaged and may not play properly.
Do not use lens cleaners. Doing so may damage the CD player.
MP3 (MPEG Audio LAYER3) is a standard audio compression format.
Files can be compressed to approximately 1/10 of their original size by using MP3 compression.
WMA (Windows Media Audio) is a Microsoft audio compression format.
This format compresses audio data to a size smaller than that of the MP3 format.
AAC is short for Advanced Audio Coding and refers to an audio compression technology standard used with MPEG2 and MPEG4.
There is a limit to the MP3, WMA and AAC file standards and to the media/formats recorded by them that can be used.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: MP3 (MPEG1 LAYER3, MPEG2 LSF LAYER3)
MPEG1 LAYER3: 32, 44.1, 48 (kHz)
MPEG2 LSF LAYER3: 16, 22.05, 24 (kHz)
MPEG1 LAYER3: 32-320 (kbps)
MPEG2 LSF LAYER3: 8-160 (kbps)

itemtxt.itemtxt: Compatible channel modes: stereo, joint stereo, dual channel and monaural
Compatible bit rates (only compatible with 2-channel playback)

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Ver. 7, 8: CBR 48-192 (kbps)
MPEG4/AAC-LC
1ch, 2ch (Dual channel is not supported)
Media that can be used for MP3, WMA and AAC playback are CD-Rs and CD-RWs.
Playback in some instances may not be possible, depending on the status of the CD-R or CD-RW. Playback may not be possible or the audio may jump if the disc is scratched or marked with fingerprints.
The following disc formats can be used.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Disc formats: CD-ROM Mode 1 and Mode 2 CD-ROM XA Mode 2, Form 1 and Form 2
File formats: ISO9660 Level 1, Level 2, (Romeo, Joliet) UDF2.01

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: MP3, WMA and AAC files written in any format other than those listed above may not play correctly, and their file names and folder names may not be displayed correctly.
Items related to standards and limitations are as follows.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Maximum directory hierarchy: 8 levels (including the root)
Maximum length of folder names/file names: 32 characters
Maximum number of folders: 192 (including the root)
Maximum number of files per disc: 255

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: The only files that can be recognized as MP3/WMA/AAC and played are those with the extension .mp3, .wma or .m4a.
As the audio system is compatible with multi-sessions, it is possible to play discs that contain MP3, WMA and AAC files. However, only the first session can be played.
ID3 tags can be added to MP3 files, making it possible to record the track title, artist name, etc.
The system is compatible with ID3 Ver. 1.0, 1.1, and Ver. 2.2, 2.3 ID3 tags. (The number of characters is based on ID3 Ver. 1.0 and 1.1.)
WMA tags can be added to WMA files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.
AAC tags can be added to AAC files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.

When a disc containing MP3, WMA or AAC files is inserted, all files on the disc are first checked. Once the file check is finished, the first MP3, WMA or AAC file is played. To make the file check finish more quickly, we recommend you do not write in any files other than MP3, WMA or AAC files or create any unnecessary folders.
If the discs contain a mixture of music data and MP3, WMA or AAC format data, only music data can be played.

If the file extensions .mp3, .wma and .m4a. are used for files other than MP3, WMA and AAC files, they will be mistakenly recognized and played as MP3, WMA and AAC files. This may result in large amounts of interference and damage to the speakers.

itemtxt.itemtxt: To play MP3 file with steady sound quality, we recommend a fixed bit rate of 128 kbps and a sampling frequency of 44.1 kHz.
CD-R or CD-RW playback may not be possible in some instances, depending on the characteristics of the disc.

There is a wide variety of freeware and other encoding software for MP3, WMA and AAC files on the market, and depending on the status of the encoding and the file format, poor sound quality or noise at the start of playback may result. In some cases, playback may not be possible at all.
When files other than MP3, WMA or AAC files are recorded on a disc, it may take more time to recognize the disc and in some cases, playback may not be possible at all.
Microsoft, Windows, and Windows Media are the registered trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the U.S.A. and other countries.

title.title: Discs and adapters that cannot be used

p.p: Do not use the following types of discs.
Also, do not use 8 cm (3 in.) disc adapters, DualDiscs or printable discs.
Doing so may damage the player and/or the disc insert/eject function.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Discs that have a diameter that is not 12 cm (4.7 in.)
Discs with a transparent or translucent recording area
Discs that have tape, stickers or CD-R labels attached to them, or that have had the label peeled off

p.p: Failure to follow the precautions below may result in serious damage to the discs or the player itself.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not insert anything other than discs into the disc slot.
Do not apply oil to the player.
Store discs away from direct sunlight.
Never try to disassemble any part of the player.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Connecting an iPod enables you to enjoy music from the vehicle speakers. Press the “MODE” button until “iPod” is displayed.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off
Press: Displaying list of the current folder

steptxt.steptxt: Turning the “TUNE•SELECT” knob clockwise changes the play mode in the following order: “Playlists”→“Artists”→“Albums”→“Songs”→“Genres”→“Composers”→“Radio”→“Audiobooks”→“Podcasts”→“iTunes U”
Press the knob to select the desired play mode.
Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to display the first selection list.
Press the knob to select the desired item and display the second selection list.
Repeat the same procedure to select the desired item.

p.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to select the desired song.

title.title: Selecting a song from the song list

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: The song list will be displayed.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to select a song.
Press the knob to play the song.

p.p: Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.
Album repeat mode may not be available depending on the iPod devices you have.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Use of the Made for Apple badge means that an accessory has been designed to connect specifically to the Apple product(s) identified in the badge, and has been certified by the developer to meet Apple performance standards. Apple is not responsible for the operation of this device or its compliance with safety and regulatory standards. Please note that the use of this accessory with an Apple product may affect wireless performance.
iTunes U, iPod, iPod touch, iPod nano and iPhone are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
When an iPod is connected and the audio source is changed to iPod mode, the iPod will resume play from the same point in which it was last used.
Depending on the iPod that is connected to the system, certain functions may not be available. Disconnecting the device and reconnecting it once again may resolve some malfunctions.
While connected to the system, the iPod cannot be operated with its own controls. It is necessary to use the controls of the vehicle’s audio system instead.

p.p: To resolve most problems encountered when using your iPod, disconnect your iPod from the vehicle iPod connection and reset it.
For instructions on how to reset your iPod, refer to your iPod Owner’s Manual.
If an error message is displayed, refer to the following table and take the appropriate measures. If the problem is not rectified, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer.
This indicates that the data in the iPod cannot be read.
This indicates that the iPod may be malfunctioning.
This indicates that an over current error has occurred.
This indicates that an iPod communication error has occurred.
This indicates that an authentication error has occurred.
This indicates that there is no music data in the iPod.
This indicates that some available songs are not found in a selected playlist.
This indicates that the version of the iPod is not compatible. Upgrade your iPod software to the latest version.
The following devices can be used with this system.
This system only supports audio playback.
Depending on differences between models or software versions etc., some models might be incompatible with this system.
Do not connect iPod or operate the controls. Doing so may cause an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not leave iPod in the vehicle. The temperature inside the vehicle may become high, resulting in damage to the iPod.
Do not push down on or apply unnecessary pressure to the iPod while it is connected as this may damage the iPod or its terminal.
Do not insert foreign objects into the port as this may damage the iPod or its terminal.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Connecting a USB memory enables you to enjoy music from the vehicle speakers. Press the “MODE” button until “USB” is displayed.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Press: Turning the audio system on or off

title.title: Selecting folders one at a time
Selecting a folder and file from folder list

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: The folder list will be displayed.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn and press the knob to select a folder and file.

p.p: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob or press the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button to move up or down to select the desired file.
Press and hold the “SEEK >” or “< TRACK” button until you hear a beep.
Available except when “RDM” (random play) is selected

itemtxt.itemtxt: Depending on the USB memory that is connected to the system, the device itself may not be operable and certain functions may not be available. If the device is inoperable or a function is unavailable due to a malfunction (as opposed to a system specification), disconnecting the device and reconnecting it once again may resolve the problem.
If the USB memory still does not begin operation after being disconnected and reconnected, format the memory.

p.p: If an error message is displayed, refer to the following table and take the appropriate measures. If the problem is not rectified, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer.
This indicates that the data in the USB memory cannot be read.
This indicates that the USB memory may be malfunctioning.
This indicates that an over current error has occurred.
This indicates that the USB memory communication error has occurred.
This indicates that no MP3/WMA/AAC files are included on the USB memory device.
This indicates that the hub connect error occurs.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: USB memory that can be used for MP3, WMA and AAC playback
The following device formats can be used:
MP3, WMA and AAC files written in any format other than those listed above may not play correctly, and their file names and folder names may not be displayed correctly.
Items related to standards and limitations are as follows:

itemtxt.itemtxt: Maximum directory hierarchy: 8 levels (including the root)
Maximum number of folders in a device: 3000
Maximum number of files in a device: 9999
Maximum number of files per folder: 255

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: MP3 (MPEG Audio LAYER3) is a standard audio compression format.
Files can be compressed to approximately 1/10 of their original size by using MP3 compression.
WMA (Windows Media Audio) is a Microsoft audio compression format.
This format compresses audio data to a size smaller than that of the MP3 format.
AAC is short for Advanced Audio Coding and refers to an audio compression technology standard used with MPEG2 and MPEG4.
There is a limit to the MP3, WMA and AAC file standards and to the media/formats recorded by them that can be used.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Compatible channel modes: stereo, joint stereo, dual channel and monaural
Compatible bit rates (only compatible with 2-channel playback)

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: MPEG4/AAC-LC
1ch, 2ch (Dual channel is not supported)
The only files that can be recognized as MP3/WMA/AAC and played are those with the extension .mp3, .wma or .m4a.
ID3 tags can be added to MP3 files, making it possible to record the track title, artist name, etc.
The system is compatible with ID3 Ver. 1.0, 1.1, and Ver. 2.2, 2.3, 2.4 ID3 tags. (The number of characters is based on ID3 Ver. 1.0 and 1.1.)
WMA tags can be added to WMA files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.
AAC tags can be added to AAC files, making it possible to record the track title and artist name in the same way as with ID3 tags.

itemtxt.itemtxt: When a device containing MP3, WMA or AAC files is connected, all files in the USB memory device are checked. Once the file check is finished, the first MP3, WMA or AAC file is played. To make the file check finish more quickly, we recommend that you do not include any files other than MP3, WMA or AAC files or create any unnecessary folders.

When the USB device is connected and the audio source is changed to USB memory mode, the USB device will start playing the first file in the first folder. If the same device is removed and reinserted (and the contents have not been changed), the USB memory will resume play from the same point in which it was last used.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: If the file extensions .mp3, .wma and .m4a. are used for files other than MP3, WMA and AAC files, they will be skipped (not played).

itemtxt.itemtxt: To play MP3 files with steady sound quality, we recommend a fixed bit rate of at least 128 kbps and a sampling frequency of 44.1 kHz.

There is a wide variety of freeware and other encoding software for MP3, WMA and AAC files on the market, and depending on the status of the encoding and the file format, poor sound quality or noise at the start of playback may result. In some cases, playback may not be possible at all.
Microsoft, Windows, and Windows Media are registered trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the U.S.A. and other countries.

p.p: Do not connect USB memory or operate the controls. Doing so may cause an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.

title.title: To prevent damage to USB memory

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not leave USB memory in the vehicle. The temperature inside the vehicle may become high, resulting in damage to the USB memory.
Do not push down on or apply unnecessary pressure to the USB memory while it is connected as this may damage the USB memory or its terminal.
Do not insert foreign objects into the port as this may damage the USB memory or its terminal.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: This port can be used to connect a portable audio device and listen to it using the vehicle’s speakers. Press the “MODE” button until “AUX” is displayed.

title.title: Operating portable audio devices connected to the audio system

p.p: The volume can be adjusted using the vehicle audio controls. All other adjustments must be made on the portable audio device itself.

title.title: When using a portable audio device connected to the power outlet

p.p: Noise may occur during playback. Use the power source of the portable audio device.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Turns the hands-free system on/starts a call
Turns the hands-free system off/ends a call/refuses a call
Press: Turning the audio system on or off
Displays setup menu or selects items such as menu and number
A message, name, number, etc. is displayed.

p.p: To enter a menu, press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and navigate menus by using the knob.

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The steering wheel switches can be used to operate a connected cellular phone, or portable digital audio player (portable player).

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the switch is pressed during a call, the call will end.
If the switch is pressed when an incoming call is received, the call will be answered.
If the switch is pressed when a call waiting call is received, the waiting call will be answered.
Press the “+” side to increase the volume.
Press the “-” side to decrease the volume.
If the switch is pressed during a call, the call will end.
If the switch is pressed when an incoming call is received, the call will be answered.
If the switch is pressed when a call waiting call is received, the waiting call will be answered.
Press the “+” side to increase the volume.
Press the “-” side to decrease the volume.

steptxt.steptxt: Press the “TUNE•SELECT” knob and select “Bluetooth” using the knob.
Press the knob and select “Pairing” using the knob.

p.p: If the off-hook button is pressed and the “PHONE” mode is entered when no phones have been registered, the registration screen will be automatically displayed.
Select “List phone” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob. The list of registered cellular phones will be displayed.

title.title: Connecting the registered cellular phone to the audio system

steptxt.steptxt: Select the name of the cellular phone to be connected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Select” using the knob.
Select the name of the cellular phone to be deleted using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Delete” using the knob.

title.title: Disconnecting the registered cellular phone from the audio system

steptxt.steptxt: Select the name of the cellular phone to be disconnected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Disconnect” using the knob.

p.p: Select “List audio” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob. The list of registered portable players will be displayed.

title.title: Connecting the registered portable player to the audio system

steptxt.steptxt: Select the name of the portable player to be connected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Select” using the knob.
Select the name of the portable player to be deleted using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Delete” using the knob.

title.title: Disconnecting the registered portable player from the audio system

steptxt.steptxt: Select the name of the portable player to be disconnected using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Disconnect” using the knob.
Select the name of the desired portable player using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select “Connection method” using the knob.
Select “From vehicle” or “From audio” using the knob.
Select “Passkey” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select a 4 to 8-digit passkey using the knob.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Input the number 1 digit at a time.

title.title: Setting automatic connection of the device on or off

p.p: If “BT power OFF” is set to on, the registered device will be connected automatically when the engine switch is turned to ACC or OFF.
Select “BT power ON” or “BT power OFF” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.

title.title: Setting the automatic connection confirmation display to on or off

p.p: If the “Display setting” is set to on, the portable player connection status will be displayed when the engine switch is turned to ACC or OFF.
Select “Display setting ON” or “Display setting OFF” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Automatic connection of a portable device, automatic connection confirmation display and the passkey will be initialized.

Select “Dial by number” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Enter the phone number and press the off-hook switch.
Select “All calls”, “Missed calls”, “Incoming calls” or “Outgoing calls” using the “TUNE•SELECT” knob.
Select a desired number using the knob and press the off-hook button.

p.p: The following operations can be performed:

itemtxt.itemtxt: Registering a number as a Favorite

title.title: Receiving a call when on another call

p_sub.p_sub: Pressing the off-hook button again returns you to the previous call.

p.p: This function may not be available depending on the type of cellular phone.

title.title: Adjusting the ring tone volume when receiving a call

p.p: To decrease the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob counterclockwise.
To increase the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob clockwise.
A call can be transferred between the cellular phone and system while dialing, receiving a call, or during a call. Use one of the following methods:

p_sub.p_sub: Refer to the manual that comes with the cellular phone for the operation of the phone.

p.p: This operation can be performed only when transferring a call from the cellular phone to the system during a call.
This operation cannot be performed while driving.

steptxt.steptxt: Turn the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to select the desired number.
Press the knob to decide the number.

p.p: When the “p” symbol is dialed in an outgoing call, there will be a pause for 2 seconds before the following digits are dialed automatically.
This operation can be performed while driving.
Your voice volume that the other party hears from their speaker can be adjusted.

steptxt.steptxt: Use the “TUNE•SELECT” knob to adjust the volume. (-5 to +5)

p.p: To decrease the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob counterclockwise.
To increase the volume: Turn the “POWER VOLUME” knob clockwise.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not talk simultaneously with the other party.
Keep the volume of the received voice down. Otherwise, voice echo will increase.

p.p: When vehicle speed is 80 km/h (50 mph) or more, the volume automatically increases. The volume returns to the previous volume setting when vehicle speed drops to 70 km/h (43 mph) or less.
Depending on the cellular phone, certain functions may not be available.

title.title: Situations where the system may not recognize your voice

itemtxt.itemtxt: When driving on a rough road
When air is blowing out of the vents onto the microphone
When the air conditioning fans emits a loud noise
In the following situations, the system may not function.
The cellular phone is located outside the service area
Depending on the type of portable audio player that is connected to the system, operation may differ slightly and certain functions may not be available.

title.title: When transferring ownership of the vehicle

p.p: Bluetooth is a registered trademark of Bluetooth SIG, Inc.

itemtxt.itemtxt: A2DP (Advanced Audio Distribution Profile) Ver. 1.0, or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.3)

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to transmit stereo audio or high quality sound to the audio system.

itemtxt.itemtxt: AVRCP (Audio/Video Remote Control Profile) Ver. 1.0 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.6)

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to allow remote control the A/V equipment.

p.p: However, please note that some functions may be limited depending on the type of portable audio player connected.
The hands-free system supports cellular phones with the following specifications.

itemtxt.itemtxt: HFP (Hands Free Profile) Ver. 1.0 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.7)

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to allow hands-free phone calls using a cellular phone or head set. It has outgoing and incoming call functions.

itemtxt.itemtxt: OPP (Object Push Profile) Ver. 1.1 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.2)
PBAP (Phone Book Access Profile) Ver. 1.0 or higher (Recommended: Ver. 1.2)

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: This is a profile to transfer phonebook data.

title.title: Caution regarding interference with electronic devices

p.p: Do not leave your portable audio player or cellular phone in the vehicle. The inside of the vehicle may become hot, causing damage to the portable audio player or cellular phone.
